translated: “Having climbed up to the top of the tree,🔽the king of the deer will listen
to the counsel of the one who is the leader in counsel,
having descended down from the tree.
What the golden one counsels with the golden one,
what does that have to do with the one with four feet,
enter your hole, O rose-apple tree!”
The Birth Story of Catumaṭṭha is the seventh.
